alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 4:49PM MST until June 24 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 449 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Covered Wells and Mountain Village. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
